Use principles of equilibrium and the force due to the magnetic field.

The weight of the conductor rod cd is W = mg = 0.1 N.
The magnetic force on the conductor rod cd is given by F_B = I_1 L B_1.
The direction of the magnetic field is in the negative z-direction.
The current I_1 must be in the positive x-direction for the magnetic force to be in the positive y-direction.
Set up the equilibrium condition: F_B = W.
The direction of the current I_1 is in the positive x-direction.
The magnitude of the current I_1 is 0.2 A, and the direction is in the positive x-direction.
